156493: Yes, goldfish do grow. In fact, they can grow quite large – up to 12 inches or more in some cases. Of course, this depends on the type of goldfish and the conditions in which they are kept. Generally speaking, goldfish kept in bowls or small tanks don’t grow to their full potential because of the limited space and lack of proper filtration. But in a large pond with good water quality, goldfish have been known to reach sizes of 2-3 feet!
1110199:
Wifi and Bluetooth are two different wireless technologies that are commonly used in a variety of devices, such as smartphones, laptops, and speakers. Both wifi and Bluetooth allow devices to connect to the internet or to each other without the use of wires or cables.

Bluetooth is a short-range wireless technology that is typically used to connect devices that are close to each other, such as a smartphone and a wireless headset. Bluetooth has a relatively low energy consumption and is often used in devices that need to be small and portable.

Wifi is a long-range wireless technology that is typically used to connect devices that are far apart, such as a laptop and a wireless router. Wifi uses more power than Bluetooth, but it can provide a higher data rate.
1063750:
On April 6, 1917, the United States Congress passed a resolution declaring war on Germany, officially entering World War I. The move came after nearly three years of neutrality, as American public opinion slowly began to turn in favor of intervention.

The United States had initially hoped to stay out of the conflict, which began in 1914. But as the war dragged on, and as reports of atrocities mounted, American opinion began to change. President Woodrow Wilson, who had been elected in 1916 on a platform of keeping the United States out of the war, eventually came to believe that American intervention was necessary to make the world "safe for democracy."

In early 1917, Germany made a move that finally tipped the scales in favor of intervention. The country announced that it would resume unrestricted submarine warfare, sinking any ship that entered war zones, regardless of whether it was carrying civilians or munitions. This move, coupled with the Zimmermann Telegram, in which Germany proposed a military alliance with Mexico, led to a major shift in American public opinion.

On April 2, 1917, Wilson went before Congress and asked for a declaration of war. The resolution passed on April 6, and the United States formally entered World War I.
130510: A declaratory judgment is a ruling by a court on the legal status of a person, thing, or situation.
489204: Pelvic pain can have many different causes. 573724: The social determinants of health are the conditions in which people are born, grow, work, live, and age, and the wider set of forces and systems shaping the conditions of daily life. These forces and systems include economic, social, and political structures and processes. The social determinants of health are mostly responsible for health inequities - the unfair and avoidable differences in health status seen within and between countries.

527433: There are many types of dysarthria that can occur in people with cerebral palsy. The most common type is spastic dysarthria, which is caused by damage to the motor control centers of the brain. This can lead to problems with muscle control and coordination, which can make it difficult to speak clearly. Other types of dysarthria include flaccid dysarthria, which is caused by damage to the nerves that control the muscles of the face, and ataxic dysarthria, which is caused by damage to the cerebellum, the part of the brain that controls balance and coordination.

264014: A flea's life cycle consists of four stages: egg, larva, pupa, and adult. The entire cycle, from egg to adult, can take as little as two weeks or as long as eight months, depending on the temperature and humidity.
1121402: Contour plowing is a type of agricultural land preparation in which the land is plowed along lines of consistent elevation in order to reduce soil erosion. The practice is often used on hillsides in order to minimize the amount of rainwater that runs off of the land and causes erosion. Contour plowing can also help to improve drainage and increase the amount of water that is available to plants.
962179: The Salvation Army was founded in 1865 by William Booth. The organization's stated mission is "to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination".
1117099: Active margins are tectonic plate boundaries where one plate is moving underneath the other. The plates are moving in opposite directions and the lower plate is being forced underneath the upper plate. This type of boundary is found at convergent boundaries.
148538:
There are a few key differences between registered nurses (RNs) and Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) nurses. Firstly, RNs only need an associate’s degree or diploma in nursing, while BSN nurses must have a bachelor’s degree. Secondly, RNs can find work in a variety of settings, while BSN nurses typically work in hospitals. Finally, RNs typically have more patient contact than BSN nurses.

While both RNs and BSN nurses are important members of the healthcare team, they play different roles. RNs typically provide direct patient care, while BSN nurses may have more of a focus on patient education and discharge planning. BSN nurses may also be involved in research and quality improvement initiatives.

So, while both RNs and BSN nurses are important, they are not interchangeable. The role that each nurse plays is dictated by their education and experience.
451602: Medicare's definition of mechanical ventilation is any artificially induced movement of air into and out of the lungs. This can be done using a machine called a ventilator, or by manually pumping air into the lungs. Mechanical ventilation is used to treat patients who are unable to breathe on their own, and it can be used on a short-term or long-term basis.
359349: The midsegment of a trapezoid is the line segment that connects the midpoints of the trapezoid's two bases. To find the midsegment of a trapezoid, first find the midpoints of the trapezoid's two bases. To do this, divide the length of each base by 2. Then, draw a line segment between the two midpoints. This line segment is the midsegment of the trapezoid.

This can involve reviewing customer records, analyzing transaction patterns, and identifying suspicious activity. 1132213:
Yoga is a popular form of exercise that can be used to improve flexibility and strength. One of the key poses in yoga is the bow pose, which requires you to hold your body in a bow-like position.

So, how long should you hold the bow pose in yoga?

The answer depends on your level of experience and comfort with the pose. If you are a beginner, it is best to hold the pose for a short period of time, such as 30 seconds. As you become more comfortable with the pose, you can gradually increase the amount of time you hold it.

If you are looking to improve your flexibility, it is best to hold the pose for a longer period of time. For example, you could try holding the pose for 1-2 minutes. Remember to listen to your body and only hold the pose for as long as you feel comfortable.

So, there is no definitive answer to how long you should hold the bow pose in yoga. It all depends on your level of experience and comfort with the pose. Start with a shorter duration and gradually increase the amount of time you hold the pose as you become more comfortable with it.
1114819: Durable medical equipment (DME) is a term used to describe any type of equipment that can be used to provide medical or therapeutic benefits to patients. This type of equipment is designed to be durable and long-lasting, so that it can be used by patients on a regular basis. Some examples of common DME items include hospital beds, wheelchairs, and oxygen tanks.
183378: The definition of an exon is a sequence of DNA that codes for a protein. Exons are found in the genes of eukaryotic organisms. Eukaryotic genes are composed of both exons and introns. Introns are intervening sequences of DNA that are not translated into proteins.
1106007: The visceral layer is a type of connective tissue that covers and protects the organs in the body. It is made up of a thin layer of epithelial tissue and a thick layer of connective tissue. The visceral layer is important for keeping the organs in place and for protecting them from injury.
1124210: The tracheids are part of the xylem, which is the primary means of water transport in plants. The xylem is a complex system of cells that includes the tracheids, vessel elements, and parenchyma cells. The tracheids are the primary cell type in the xylem and are responsible for most of the water transport in plants. The tracheids are long, thin cells with many pores that allow water to flow from the roots to the leaves. The vessel elements are the second type of cell in the xylem and are responsible for the transport of water and minerals from the roots to the leaves. The parenchyma cells are the third type of cell in the xylem and are responsible for storage, support, and repair.
287683: A total of 27 Liberty ships were built in Brunswick, Georgia during World War II. Brunswick was one of the largest shipyards in the country and was responsible for constructing a significant number of Liberty ships.
490595: RSA is a public-key encryption algorithm and the standard for encrypting data sent over the internet. It is also used to generate digital signatures. The algorithm is named after Ron Rivest, Adi Shamir, and Len Adleman, who invented it in 1977. RSA is a relatively slow algorithm and is not suitable for very large data sets. However, it is still widely used due to its security.
1103812: The Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) is a regional intergovernmental organization of nine member states, all of which are former Soviet Republics. It was formed on December 8, 1991, shortly after the dissolution of the Soviet Union. The CIS's main goals are to promote cooperation and economic integration, as well as to protect the member states' sovereignty and independence.
87181: Left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) is a condition in which the heart muscle becomes thickened and enlarged. This can be caused by a variety of factors, including high blood pressure, diabetes, and sleep apnea. LVH can lead to serious health complications, such as heart failure and stroke. Therefore, it is important to be aware of the causes of LVH and to seek medical treatment if you are at risk.
443396:
LPS laws are a set of California state statutes that govern the operation of public agencies that provide mental health services. The laws are also known as the Lanterman-Petris-Short Act, or LPS Act. 

The LPS Act was enacted in 1967 in response to concerns about the treatment of people with mental illness. The act established a system of involuntary commitment and treatment for people with mental illness. It also created a system of community-based mental health services.

The LPS Act governs the involuntary commitment of people with mental illness. It requires that a person must be a danger to themselves or others, or be gravely disabled, in order to be involuntarily committed. The act also requires that a person must receive a hearing before a judge before they can be involuntarily committed.

The LPS Act also governs the involuntary treatment of people with mental illness. It requires that a person must be found to be a danger to themselves or others, or be gravely disabled, in order to be involuntarily treated. The act also requires that a person must receive a hearing before a judge before they can be involuntarily treated.

The LPS Act also created a system of community-based mental health services. The act established a system of mental health courts, which are courts that specialize in cases involving people with mental illness. The act also created a system of mental health diversion, which allows people with mental illness to be diverted from the criminal justice system and into treatment.
87452:
In recent years, military suicide rates have increased significantly. While the reasons for this are complex and varied, there are a few major contributing factors.

Firstly, the nature of military work has changed drastically in recent years. With more and more soldiers being deployed to combat zones, they are exposed to more trauma and stress than ever before. This can lead to mental health problems such as depression and anxiety, which can in turn lead to suicidal thoughts.

Secondly, the military culture has long been one of stoicism and silence. This means that many soldiers are reluctant to seek help for mental health problems, for fear of being seen as weak or a burden. This can make it very difficult for them to get the help they need, and can lead to them feeling isolated and hopeless.

If you or someone you know is struggling with suicidal thoughts, please seek help. There are many resources available, and you are not alone.
855410: Theraderm is a medication used to treat a variety of skin conditions. It is a topical corticosteroid that is applied to the skin. Theraderm is used to treat inflammation and itching caused by a variety of conditions such as eczema, psoriasis, and seborrheic dermatitis. It works by reducing inflammation and swelling. Theraderm is available in a cream, ointment, and solution. It is typically applied to the affected area two to four times daily.
1114646: Famvir is a prescription medication used to treat viral infections. It is a nucleoside analog antiviral drug that works by interfering with the replication of viral DNA. Famvir is used to treat infections caused by herpes simplex virus, varicella zoster virus, and Epstein-Barr virus. It is also used to prevent recurrent episodes of herpes simplex virus infection.

182539: A monotonic function is a function that either increases or decreases as you move from left to right. An example of a monotonic function is the function f(x) = x2. As you can see, as the input x increases, so does the output f(x).

1129237:
According to a new study, hydrogen is a liquid below what temperature.

The study, conducted by researchers at the University of Tokyo, found that hydrogen is a liquid below -253 degrees Celsius.

This is the first time that scientists have been able to show that hydrogen is a liquid at such low temperatures.

The findings could have important implications for the development of hydrogen fuel cells, which could be used to power everything from cars to homes.

Hydrogen fuel cells are seen as a clean and efficient alternative to fossil fuels, and the new study could help to make them a reality.
146187:
The McDonald's McDouble and Double Cheeseburger are both popular menu items. But what's the difference between the two?

The McDouble is a double cheeseburger with two 100% beef patties, cheese, onions, pickles, and ketchup on a toasted bun. The Double Cheeseburger, on the other hand, has one 100% beef patty, cheese, onions, pickles, and ketchup on a toasted bun.

So, the main difference between the two is that the McDouble has two beef patties, while the Double Cheeseburger has only one. The McDouble is also a bit taller than the Double Cheeseburger.

Both menu items are reasonably priced and make for a filling meal. So, whether you go for the McDouble or the Double Cheeseburger, you can't go wrong.
